message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a novel approach to improve the performance of locally connected layers in neural networks, which is a common component in computer vision and natural language processing tasks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces a new method for determining the importance and relations of different local receptive fields, which involves modeling the location relations among them using a multi-variate Gaussian function. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper's focus on improving the performance of neural networks suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper's potential applications in natural language processing tasks suggest that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language).
